The claim is supported by the latest U: S. Bureau of Labor Statistics numbers, which reported a 1.1% increase in real average hourly earnings in November compared to 2018.
Real median weekly wages for all full: time workers also saw a rise of 1.3% over the course of the year, using government data.
The increase of 1: 1% in real wages is consistent with the long-running economic growth the country has experienced, although it is not the highest increase seen in recent years.
